intro: Scabiosa simplex, commonly known as the sweet William, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers that resemble tiny bells. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden beds and borders. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
